intro: Benitzia, commonly known as the California buckthorn, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rhamnaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Benitzia californica, which is native to the western United States. These plants are shrubs or small trees characterized by their simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The fruits are small, black berries that are typically produced in clusters. Benitzia species are adapted to dry, sunny environments and are often found in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats.
